children.value: is a standard interface for interactions with methods and events described in

. These interactions are extended from the ERC20 and DSToken standard token interfaces and are generally concerned with managing the native token assigned to a colony. This includes operations such as minting tokens, burning tokens, and transferring tokens.
All callers return promises which resolve to an object containing the given return values.

children.value: Transfer tokens from one address to another address. The address the tokens are transferred from must have a sufficient token balance and it must have a sufficient token allowance approved by the token owner.
The address from which tokens will be transferred.
The address to which tokens will be transferred.
The amount of tokens that will be transferred.
